trans-unit.source: Release Notes for Azure BizTalk Services
trans-unit.target: Release Notes for Azure BizTalk Services

trans-unit.source: The release notes for the <token>af_integration_full</token> contain the known issues in this release.
trans-unit.target: The release notes for the <token>af_integration_full</token> contain the known issues in this release.

trans-unit.source: What’s new in the November update of BizTalk Services
trans-unit.target: What’s new in the November update of BizTalk Services

trans-unit.source: Encryption at Rest can be enabled in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: Encryption at Rest can be enabled in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="72e428fd-250c-4d3a-b4ed-16c216094bbe" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Enable Encryption at Rest in BizTalk Services Portal</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="72e428fd-250c-4d3a-b4ed-16c216094bbe" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Enable Encryption at Rest in BizTalk Services Portal</link>.

trans-unit.source: Update History
trans-unit.target: Update History

trans-unit.source: Update
trans-unit.target: Update

trans-unit.source: Changes
trans-unit.target: Changes

trans-unit.source: October Update
trans-unit.target: October Update

trans-unit.source: Organizational accounts are supported:
trans-unit.target: Organizational accounts are supported:

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Scenario</legacyBold>: You registered a BizTalk Service deployment using a Microsoft account (like user@live.com).
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Scenario</legacyBold>: You registered a BizTalk Service deployment using a Microsoft account (like user@live.com).

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, only Microsoft Account users can manage the BizTalk Service using the BizTalk Services portal.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, only Microsoft Account users can manage the BizTalk Service using the BizTalk Services portal.

trans-unit.source: An organizational account cannot be used.
trans-unit.target: An organizational account cannot be used.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Scenario</legacyBold>: You registered a BizTalk Service deployment using an organizational account in an Azure Active Directory (like user@fabrikam.com or user@contoso.com).
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Scenario</legacyBold>: You registered a BizTalk Service deployment using an organizational account in an Azure Active Directory (like user@fabrikam.com or user@contoso.com).

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, only Azure Active Directory users within the same organization can manage the BizTalk Service using the BizTalk Services portal.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, only Azure Active Directory users within the same organization can manage the BizTalk Service using the BizTalk Services portal.

trans-unit.source: A Microsoft account cannot be used.
trans-unit.target: A Microsoft account cannot be used.

trans-unit.source: When you create a BizTalk Service in the <token>azportal</token>, you are automatically registered in the <token>af_integration</token> Portal.
trans-unit.target: When you create a BizTalk Service in the <token>azportal</token>, you are automatically registered in the <token>af_integration</token> Portal.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Scenario</legacyBold>: You log into the <token>azportal</token>, create a BizTalk Service, and then select <embeddedLabel>Manage</embeddedLabel> for the very first time.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Scenario</legacyBold>: You log into the <token>azportal</token>, create a BizTalk Service, and then select <embeddedLabel>Manage</embeddedLabel> for the very first time.

trans-unit.source: When the <token>af_integration</token> portal opens, the BizTalk Service automatically registers and is ready for your deployments.
trans-unit.target: When the <token>af_integration</token> portal opens, the BizTalk Service automatically registers and is ready for your deployments.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="7c9bae82-8d07-45df-bf51-b0b31417a9d4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Registering and Updating a BizTalk Service Deployment on the BizTalk Services Portal</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="7c9bae82-8d07-45df-bf51-b0b31417a9d4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Registering and Updating a BizTalk Service Deployment on the BizTalk Services Portal</link>.

trans-unit.source: August 14 Update
trans-unit.target: August 14 Update

trans-unit.source: Agreement and bridge decoupling – Trading partner agreements and bridges are now decoupled in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: Agreement and bridge decoupling – Trading partner agreements and bridges are now decoupled in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: You now create agreements and bridges separately, and at runtime bridges resolve to an agreement based on the values in the EDI message.
trans-unit.target: You now create agreements and bridges separately, and at runtime bridges resolve to an agreement based on the values in the EDI message.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="df2ee20f-a063-42f8-b9d1-ea6c3abdbfed" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Agreements in Azure BizTalk Services</link>, <link xlink:href="458c2c17-be30-4fdb-b438-5683e38dd9c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an EDI bridge using BizTalk Services Portal</link>, <link xlink:href="7894ebb3-c8f9-45db-942b-ed487656d6b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 bridge using BizTalk Services Portal</link>, and <link xlink:href="f3a8d261-0ada-4798-b079-68ede2cda850" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How do bridges resolve to agreements at runtime?</link>
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="df2ee20f-a063-42f8-b9d1-ea6c3abdbfed" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Agreements in Azure BizTalk Services</link>, <link xlink:href="458c2c17-be30-4fdb-b438-5683e38dd9c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an EDI bridge using BizTalk Services Portal</link>, <link xlink:href="7894ebb3-c8f9-45db-942b-ed487656d6b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 bridge using BizTalk Services Portal</link>, and <link xlink:href="f3a8d261-0ada-4798-b079-68ede2cda850" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How do bridges resolve to agreements at runtime?</link>

trans-unit.source: The option to create templates for agreements is discontinued.
trans-unit.target: The option to create templates for agreements is discontinued.

trans-unit.source: For the send-side agreement, you can now specify different delimiter sets for each schema.
trans-unit.target: For the send-side agreement, you can now specify different delimiter sets for each schema.

trans-unit.source: This configuration is specified under protocol settings for send side agreement.
trans-unit.target: This configuration is specified under protocol settings for send side agreement.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an X12 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link> and <link xlink:href="2cc7653d-20e9-4964-86ea-5146780ee64c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an EDIFACT Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an X12 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link> and <link xlink:href="2cc7653d-20e9-4964-86ea-5146780ee64c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an EDIFACT Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: Two new entities are also added to the TPM OM API for the same purpose.
trans-unit.target: Two new entities are also added to the TPM OM API for the same purpose.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="be688e7e-5bc4-4f3b-9260-6f1ac637b42d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">X12DelimiterOverrides</link> and <link xlink:href="60909fc7-2efa-41bc-9e2a-343827755e97" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">EDIFACTDelimiterOverride</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="be688e7e-5bc4-4f3b-9260-6f1ac637b42d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">X12DelimiterOverrides</link> and <link xlink:href="60909fc7-2efa-41bc-9e2a-343827755e97" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">EDIFACTDelimiterOverride</link>.

trans-unit.source: Standard XSD constructs, including Derived Types, are now supported.
trans-unit.target: Standard XSD constructs, including Derived Types, are now supported.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="5a028e9a-b0e7-4d44-a121-38b876f8020f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Standard XSD constructs are supported</link> and <link xlink:href="a8db0ba6-2cdd-4546-a561-afe1b96e5865" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Derived Type Mapping Scenarios and Examples</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="5a028e9a-b0e7-4d44-a121-38b876f8020f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Standard XSD constructs are supported</link> and <link xlink:href="a8db0ba6-2cdd-4546-a561-afe1b96e5865" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Derived Type Mapping Scenarios and Examples</link>.

trans-unit.source: AS2 supports new MIC algorithms for message signing and new encryption algorithms.
trans-unit.target: AS2 supports new MIC algorithms for message signing and new encryption algorithms.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: Known Issues
trans-unit.target: Known Issues

trans-unit.source: The following section lists known issues in this release of the <token>af_integration</token>:
trans-unit.target: The following section lists known issues in this release of the <token>af_integration</token>:

trans-unit.source: Connectivity Issues after BizTalk Services Portal Update
trans-unit.target: Connectivity Issues after BizTalk Services Portal Update

trans-unit.source: If you have the <token>tpm_portal</token> open while <token>af_integration</token> is upgraded to roll in changes to the service, you might face connectivity issues with the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: If you have the <token>tpm_portal</token> open while <token>af_integration</token> is upgraded to roll in changes to the service, you might face connectivity issues with the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: As a workaround, you may restart the browser, delete the browser cache, or start the portal in private mode.
trans-unit.target: As a workaround, you may restart the browser, delete the browser cache, or start the portal in private mode.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio IDE cannot locate the artifact if you click an error or warning in a BizTalk Services project
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio IDE cannot locate the artifact if you click an error or warning in a BizTalk Services project

trans-unit.source: Install the <externalLink><linkText>Visual Studio 2012 Update 3 RC 1</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=304174</linkUri></externalLink> to fix the issue.
trans-unit.target: Install the <externalLink><linkText>Visual Studio 2012 Update 3 RC 1</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=304174</linkUri></externalLink> to fix the issue.

trans-unit.source: Custom binding project reference
trans-unit.target: Custom binding project reference

trans-unit.source: Consider the following situations with a <token>af_integration</token> project in a <token>vs_current_short</token> solution:
trans-unit.target: Consider the following situations with a <token>af_integration</token> project in a <token>vs_current_short</token> solution:

trans-unit.source: In the same <token>vs_current_short</token> solution, there is a <token>af_integration</token> project <legacyUnderline>and</legacyUnderline> a custom binding project.
trans-unit.target: In the same <token>vs_current_short</token> solution, there is a <token>af_integration</token> project <legacyUnderline>and</legacyUnderline> a custom binding project.

trans-unit.source: The <token>msgflow_proj</token> has a reference to this custom binding project file.
trans-unit.target: The <token>msgflow_proj</token> has a reference to this custom binding project file.

trans-unit.source: The <token>msgflow_proj</token> has a reference to a custom binding/behavior DLL.
trans-unit.target: The <token>msgflow_proj</token> has a reference to a custom binding/behavior DLL.

trans-unit.source: You ‘Build’ the solution in <token>vs_current_short</token> successfully.
trans-unit.target: You ‘Build’ the solution in <token>vs_current_short</token> successfully.

trans-unit.source: Then, you ‘Rebuild’ or ‘Clean’ the solution.
trans-unit.target: Then, you ‘Rebuild’ or ‘Clean’ the solution.

trans-unit.source: After that, when you rebuild or clean again, the following error occurs:
trans-unit.target: After that, when you rebuild or clean again, the following error occurs:

trans-unit.source: Workaround
trans-unit.target: Workaround

trans-unit.source: If <externalLink><linkText>Visual Studio 2012 Update 3</linkText><linkUri>http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=39305</linkUri></externalLink> is installed, you have the following two options:
trans-unit.target: If <externalLink><linkText>Visual Studio 2012 Update 3</linkText><linkUri>http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=39305</linkUri></externalLink> is installed, you have the following two options:

trans-unit.source: Restart <token>vs_current_short</token>, or
trans-unit.target: Restart <token>vs_current_short</token>, or

trans-unit.source: Restart the solution.
trans-unit.target: Restart the solution.

trans-unit.source: Then, perform only a Build on the solution.
trans-unit.target: Then, perform only a Build on the solution.

trans-unit.source: If <externalLink><linkText>Visual Studio 2012 Update 3</linkText><linkUri>http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=39305</linkUri></externalLink> is <legacyUnderline><embeddedLabel>not</embeddedLabel></legacyUnderline> installed, open Task Manager, click the <embeddedLabel>Processes</embeddedLabel> tab, click the MSBuild.exe process, and then click the <embeddedLabel>End Process</embeddedLabel> button.
trans-unit.target: If <externalLink><linkText>Visual Studio 2012 Update 3</linkText><linkUri>http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=39305</linkUri></externalLink> is <legacyUnderline><embeddedLabel>not</embeddedLabel></legacyUnderline> installed, open Task Manager, click the <embeddedLabel>Processes</embeddedLabel> tab, click the MSBuild.exe process, and then click the <embeddedLabel>End Process</embeddedLabel> button.

trans-unit.source: Routing to BasicHttpRelay endpoints is not supported from <token>bridge</token>s and <token>tpm_portal</token> if non-printable characters are promoted as HTTP headers
trans-unit.target: Routing to BasicHttpRelay endpoints is not supported from <token>bridge</token>s and <token>tpm_portal</token> if non-printable characters are promoted as HTTP headers

trans-unit.source: If you use non-printable characters as part of promoted properties for messages, those messages cannot be routed to relay destinations that use the BasicHttpRelay binding.
trans-unit.target: If you use non-printable characters as part of promoted properties for messages, those messages cannot be routed to relay destinations that use the BasicHttpRelay binding.

trans-unit.source: Also, the promoted properties that are available as part of tracking are URL-encoded for blobs and un-encoded for destinations.
trans-unit.target: Also, the promoted properties that are available as part of tracking are URL-encoded for blobs and un-encoded for destinations.

trans-unit.source: MDN is sent asynchronously even if the Send asynchronous MDN option is unchecked
trans-unit.target: MDN is sent asynchronously even if the Send asynchronous MDN option is unchecked

trans-unit.source: Consider this scenario – If you select the <embeddedLabel>Send asynchronous MDN</embeddedLabel> checkbox and, specify a URL to send the async MDN to, and then uncheck the <embeddedLabel>Send asynchronous MDN</embeddedLabel> checkbox again, the MDN is still sent to the specified URL even though the option to send async MDNs is not selected.
trans-unit.target: Consider this scenario – If you select the <embeddedLabel>Send asynchronous MDN</embeddedLabel> checkbox and, specify a URL to send the async MDN to, and then uncheck the <embeddedLabel>Send asynchronous MDN</embeddedLabel> checkbox again, the MDN is still sent to the specified URL even though the option to send async MDNs is not selected.

trans-unit.source: As a workaround, you must clear the specified URL before unchecking the <embeddedLabel>Send asynchronous MDN</embeddedLabel> checkbox and then deploy the AS2 agreement.
trans-unit.target: As a workaround, you must clear the specified URL before unchecking the <embeddedLabel>Send asynchronous MDN</embeddedLabel> checkbox and then deploy the AS2 agreement.

trans-unit.source: Whitespace characters beyond a valid interchange cause an empty message to be sent to the suspend endpoint
trans-unit.target: Whitespace characters beyond a valid interchange cause an empty message to be sent to the suspend endpoint

trans-unit.source: If there are whitespaces beyond an IEA segment, the disassembler treats this as end of current interchange and looks at the next set of whitespaces as a next message.
trans-unit.target: If there are whitespaces beyond an IEA segment, the disassembler treats this as end of current interchange and looks at the next set of whitespaces as a next message.

trans-unit.source: Since this is not valid interchange, you might observe that one successful message is sent to the route destination and one empty message is sent the suspend endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Since this is not valid interchange, you might observe that one successful message is sent to the route destination and one empty message is sent the suspend endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Tracking in BizTalk Services Portal
trans-unit.target: Tracking in BizTalk Services Portal

trans-unit.source: Tracking events are captured up to the EDI message processing and any correlation.
trans-unit.target: Tracking events are captured up to the EDI message processing and any correlation.

trans-unit.source: If a message fails outside of the Protocol stage, Tracking will show as successful.
trans-unit.target: If a message fails outside of the Protocol stage, Tracking will show as successful.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, refer to the LOG section under the <ui>Details</ui> column in <ui>Tracking</ui> for error details.
trans-unit.target: In this situation, refer to the LOG section under the <ui>Details</ui> column in <ui>Tracking</ui> for error details.

trans-unit.source: The X12 Receive and Send settings (<link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an X12 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>) provide information on the Protocol stage.
trans-unit.target: The X12 Receive and Send settings (<link xlink:href="8a52d83c-900a-4ec8-ae3d-44328059f6b3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an X12 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services</link>) provide information on the Protocol stage.

trans-unit.source: Update Agreement
trans-unit.target: Update Agreement

trans-unit.source: The <token>tpm_portal</token> allows you to modify the Qualifier of an Identity when an agreement is configured.
trans-unit.target: The <token>tpm_portal</token> allows you to modify the Qualifier of an Identity when an agreement is configured.

trans-unit.source: This can result in inconsistence properties.
trans-unit.target: This can result in inconsistence properties.

trans-unit.source: For example, there is an agreement using ZZ:1234567 and ZZ:7654321 the Qualifier.
trans-unit.target: For example, there is an agreement using ZZ:1234567 and ZZ:7654321 the Qualifier.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> profile settings, you change ZZ:1234567 to be 01:<legacyItalic>ChangedValue</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> profile settings, you change ZZ:1234567 to be 01:<legacyItalic>ChangedValue</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: You open the agreement and 01:<legacyItalic>ChangedValue</legacyItalic> is displayed instead of ZZ:1234567.
trans-unit.target: You open the agreement and 01:<legacyItalic>ChangedValue</legacyItalic> is displayed instead of ZZ:1234567.

trans-unit.source: To modify the Qualifier of an identity, delete the agreement, update <ui>Identities</ui> in the partner profile and then recreate the agreement.
trans-unit.target: To modify the Qualifier of an identity, delete the agreement, update <ui>Identities</ui> in the partner profile and then recreate the agreement.

trans-unit.source: This behavior impacts X12 and AS2.
trans-unit.target: This behavior impacts X12 and AS2.

trans-unit.source: AS2 Attachments
trans-unit.target: AS2 Attachments

trans-unit.source: Attachments for AS2 messages are not supported in send or receive.
trans-unit.target: Attachments for AS2 messages are not supported in send or receive.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, attachments are silently ignored and the message body is processed as a regular AS2 message.
trans-unit.target: Specifically, attachments are silently ignored and the message body is processed as a regular AS2 message.

trans-unit.source: Resources: Remembering Path
trans-unit.target: Resources: Remembering Path

trans-unit.source: When adding <ui>Resources</ui>, the dialog window may not remember the path previously used to add a resource.
trans-unit.target: When adding <ui>Resources</ui>, the dialog window may not remember the path previously used to add a resource.

trans-unit.source: To remember the previously-used path, try adding the <token>tpm_portal</token> web site to <legacyBold>Trusted Sites</legacyBold> in Internet Explorer.
trans-unit.target: To remember the previously-used path, try adding the <token>tpm_portal</token> web site to <legacyBold>Trusted Sites</legacyBold> in Internet Explorer.

trans-unit.source: If you rename the entity name of a bridge and close the project without saving changes, opening the entity again results in an error
trans-unit.target: If you rename the entity name of a bridge and close the project without saving changes, opening the entity again results in an error

trans-unit.source: Consider a scenario in the following order:
trans-unit.target: Consider a scenario in the following order:

trans-unit.source: Add a <token>bridge</token> (for example an <token>one-way</token>) to a <token>msgflow_proj</token>
trans-unit.target: Add a <token>bridge</token> (for example an <token>one-way</token>) to a <token>msgflow_proj</token>

trans-unit.source: Rename the <token>bridge</token> by specifying a value for the <embeddedLabel>Entity Name</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: Rename the <token>bridge</token> by specifying a value for the <embeddedLabel>Entity Name</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: This renames the associated .bridgeconfig file with the name you specified.
trans-unit.target: This renames the associated .bridgeconfig file with the name you specified.

trans-unit.source: Close the .bcs file (by closing the tab in Visual Studio) without saving the changes.
trans-unit.target: Close the .bcs file (by closing the tab in Visual Studio) without saving the changes.

trans-unit.source: Open the .bcs file again from the Solution Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Open the .bcs file again from the Solution Explorer.

trans-unit.source: You will notice that while the associated .bridgeconfig file has the new name you specified, the entity name on the design surface is still the old name.
trans-unit.target: You will notice that while the associated .bridgeconfig file has the new name you specified, the entity name on the design surface is still the old name.

trans-unit.source: If you try to open the <token>msgflow</token> by double-clicking the bridge component, you get the following error:
trans-unit.target: If you try to open the <token>msgflow</token> by double-clicking the bridge component, you get the following error:

trans-unit.source: To avoid running into this scenario, make sure you save changes after you rename the entities in a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: To avoid running into this scenario, make sure you save changes after you rename the entities in a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: <token>msgflow_proj</token> builds successfully even if an artifact has been excluded from a Visual Studio project
trans-unit.target: <token>msgflow_proj</token> builds successfully even if an artifact has been excluded from a Visual Studio project

trans-unit.source: Consider a scenario where you add an artifact (for example, an XSD file) to a <token>msgflow_proj</token>, include that artifact in the <token>msgflow</token> (for example, by specifying it as a Request message type), and then exclude it from the Visual Studio project.
trans-unit.target: Consider a scenario where you add an artifact (for example, an XSD file) to a <token>msgflow_proj</token>, include that artifact in the <token>msgflow</token> (for example, by specifying it as a Request message type), and then exclude it from the Visual Studio project.

trans-unit.source: In such a case, building the project will not give any error as long as the deleted artifact is available on the disk at the same location from where it was included in the Visual Studio project.
trans-unit.target: In such a case, building the project will not give any error as long as the deleted artifact is available on the disk at the same location from where it was included in the Visual Studio project.

trans-unit.source: The <token>msgflow_proj</token> does not check for schema availability while configuring the bridges
trans-unit.target: The <token>msgflow_proj</token> does not check for schema availability while configuring the bridges

trans-unit.source: In a <token>msgflow_proj</token>, if a schema that is added to the project imports another schema, the <token>msgflow_proj</token> does not check whether the imported schema is added to the project.
trans-unit.target: In a <token>msgflow_proj</token>, if a schema that is added to the project imports another schema, the <token>msgflow_proj</token> does not check whether the imported schema is added to the project.

trans-unit.source: If you try to build such a project, you do not get any build errors.
trans-unit.target: If you try to build such a project, you do not get any build errors.

trans-unit.source: The response message for a <token>request_response</token> is always of charset UTF-8
trans-unit.target: The response message for a <token>request_response</token> is always of charset UTF-8

trans-unit.source: For this release, the charset of the response message from an <token>request_response</token> is always set to UTF-8.
trans-unit.target: For this release, the charset of the response message from an <token>request_response</token> is always set to UTF-8.

trans-unit.source: User-Defined Datatypes
trans-unit.target: User-Defined Datatypes

trans-unit.source: The <token>bap</token> adapters within the <token>lobconnect</token> feature can utilize user-defined datatypes for adapter operations.
trans-unit.target: The <token>bap</token> adapters within the <token>lobconnect</token> feature can utilize user-defined datatypes for adapter operations.

trans-unit.source: When using user-defined datatypes, copy the files (.dll) to <legacyItalic>drive</legacyItalic>:\Program Files\Microsoft BizTalk Adapter Service\BAServiceRuntime\bin\ <legacyUnderline>or</legacyUnderline> to the Global Assembly Cache (GAC) on the server hosting the <token>lobconnect</token> service.
trans-unit.target: When using user-defined datatypes, copy the files (.dll) to <legacyItalic>drive</legacyItalic>:\Program Files\Microsoft BizTalk Adapter Service\BAServiceRuntime\bin\ <legacyUnderline>or</legacyUnderline> to the Global Assembly Cache (GAC) on the server hosting the <token>lobconnect</token> service.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the following error may occur on the client:
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the following error may occur on the client:

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to use GACUtil.exe to install a file into the Global Assembly Cache.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to use GACUtil.exe to install a file into the Global Assembly Cache.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>GACUtil.exe</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=169103</linkUri></externalLink> documents how to use this tool and the Visual Studio command line options.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>GACUtil.exe</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=169103</linkUri></externalLink> documents how to use this tool and the Visual Studio command line options.

trans-unit.source: Restarting the <token>lobconnect</token> Web Site
trans-unit.target: Restarting the <token>lobconnect</token> Web Site

trans-unit.source: Installing the <legacyBold><token>lobconnect</token> Runtime</legacyBold> creates the <legacyBold><token>lobconnect</token></legacyBold> web site in IIS that contains the <legacyBold>BAService</legacyBold> application.
trans-unit.target: Installing the <legacyBold><token>lobconnect</token> Runtime</legacyBold> creates the <legacyBold><token>lobconnect</token></legacyBold> web site in IIS that contains the <legacyBold>BAService</legacyBold> application.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>BAService</embeddedLabel> application internally uses relay binding to extend the reach of on-premise service endpoint to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>BAService</embeddedLabel> application internally uses relay binding to extend the reach of on-premise service endpoint to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: For a service hosted on-premises, the corresponding relay endpoint will be registered on the Service Bus only when the on-premises service starts.
trans-unit.target: For a service hosted on-premises, the corresponding relay endpoint will be registered on the Service Bus only when the on-premises service starts.

trans-unit.source: If you stop and start an application, the configuration for auto-starting an application is not honored.
trans-unit.target: If you stop and start an application, the configuration for auto-starting an application is not honored.

trans-unit.source: So when <legacyBold>BAService</legacyBold> is stopped, you must always restart the <legacyBold><token>lobconnect</token></legacyBold> web site instead.
trans-unit.target: So when <legacyBold>BAService</legacyBold> is stopped, you must always restart the <legacyBold><token>lobconnect</token></legacyBold> web site instead.

trans-unit.source: Do <legacyUnderline>not</legacyUnderline> start or stop the <legacyBold>BAService</legacyBold> application.
trans-unit.target: Do <legacyUnderline>not</legacyUnderline> start or stop the <legacyBold>BAService</legacyBold> application.

trans-unit.source: Special characters should not be used for address and entity names of LOB components
trans-unit.target: Special characters should not be used for address and entity names of LOB components

trans-unit.source: You should not use special characters for address and entity names of LOB components.
trans-unit.target: You should not use special characters for address and entity names of LOB components.

trans-unit.source: If you do so, you will get an error while deploying the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: If you do so, you will get an error while deploying the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: For certain characters like ‘%’, the <token>lobconnect</token> website might go into a stopped state and you will have to manually start it.
trans-unit.target: For certain characters like ‘%’, the <token>lobconnect</token> website might go into a stopped state and you will have to manually start it.

trans-unit.source: Test Map with Get Context Property
trans-unit.target: Test Map with Get Context Property

trans-unit.source: If a <token>transform</token> contains a <legacyBold>Get Context Property</legacyBold> <token>mapop</token>, <embeddedLabel>Test Map</embeddedLabel> will fail.
trans-unit.target: If a <token>transform</token> contains a <legacyBold>Get Context Property</legacyBold> <token>mapop</token>, <embeddedLabel>Test Map</embeddedLabel> will fail.

trans-unit.source: As a temporary workaround, replace the <legacyBold>Get Context Property</legacyBold> <token>mapop</token> with a String Concatenate <token>mapop</token> containing dummy data.
trans-unit.target: As a temporary workaround, replace the <legacyBold>Get Context Property</legacyBold> <token>mapop</token> with a String Concatenate <token>mapop</token> containing dummy data.

trans-unit.source: This will populate the target schema and allow you test other Transform functionality.
trans-unit.target: This will populate the target schema and allow you test other Transform functionality.

trans-unit.source: Test Map Property does not display
trans-unit.target: Test Map Property does not display

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Test Map</ui> properties do not display in <token>vs_current_short</token>.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Test Map</ui> properties do not display in <token>vs_current_short</token>.

trans-unit.source: This can occur if the <ui>Properties</ui> window <legacyUnderline>and</legacyUnderline> the <ui>Solution Explorer</ui> window are not simultaneously docked.
trans-unit.target: This can occur if the <ui>Properties</ui> window <legacyUnderline>and</legacyUnderline> the <ui>Solution Explorer</ui> window are not simultaneously docked.

trans-unit.source: To resolve this, dock the <ui>Properties</ui> <legacyUnderline>and</legacyUnderline> the <ui>Solution Explorer</ui> windows.
trans-unit.target: To resolve this, dock the <ui>Properties</ui> <legacyUnderline>and</legacyUnderline> the <ui>Solution Explorer</ui> windows.

trans-unit.source: DateTime Reformat drop-down is grayed out
trans-unit.target: DateTime Reformat drop-down is grayed out

trans-unit.source: When a DateTime Reformat <token>mapop</token> is added to the design surface and configured, the Format drop-down list may be grayed out.
trans-unit.target: When a DateTime Reformat <token>mapop</token> is added to the design surface and configured, the Format drop-down list may be grayed out.

trans-unit.source: This can happen if the computer Display is set <embeddedLabel>Medium – 125%</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Larger – 150%</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: This can happen if the computer Display is set <embeddedLabel>Medium – 125%</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Larger – 150%</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: To resolve, set the display to <embeddedLabel>Smaller – 100% (default)</embeddedLabel> using the steps below:
trans-unit.target: To resolve, set the display to <embeddedLabel>Smaller – 100% (default)</embeddedLabel> using the steps below:

trans-unit.source: Open the <embeddedLabel>Control Panel</embeddedLabel> and click <embeddedLabel>Appearance and Personalization</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Open the <embeddedLabel>Control Panel</embeddedLabel> and click <embeddedLabel>Appearance and Personalization</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Display</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Display</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Smaller – 100% (default)</embeddedLabel> and click <embeddedLabel>Apply</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Smaller – 100% (default)</embeddedLabel> and click <embeddedLabel>Apply</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Format</embeddedLabel> drop-down list should now work as expected.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Format</embeddedLabel> drop-down list should now work as expected.

trans-unit.source: Duplicate agreements in the <token>tpm_portal</token>
trans-unit.target: Duplicate agreements in the <token>tpm_portal</token>

trans-unit.source: Consider the following scenario:
trans-unit.target: Consider the following scenario:

trans-unit.source: Create an agreement using the Trading Partner Management OM API.
trans-unit.target: Create an agreement using the Trading Partner Management OM API.

trans-unit.source: Open the agreement in the <token>tpm_portal</token> in two different tabs.
trans-unit.target: Open the agreement in the <token>tpm_portal</token> in two different tabs.

trans-unit.source: Deploy the agreement from both the tabs.
trans-unit.target: Deploy the agreement from both the tabs.

trans-unit.source: As a result, both the agreements get deployed resulting in duplicate entries in the <token>tpm_portal</token>
trans-unit.target: As a result, both the agreements get deployed resulting in duplicate entries in the <token>tpm_portal</token>

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Workaround</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Workaround</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Open any one of the duplicate agreements in the <token>tpm_portal</token>, and undeploy.
trans-unit.target: Open any one of the duplicate agreements in the <token>tpm_portal</token>, and undeploy.

trans-unit.source: Bridges do not use updated certificate even after a certificate has been updated in the artifact store
trans-unit.target: Bridges do not use updated certificate even after a certificate has been updated in the artifact store

trans-unit.source: Consider the following scenarios:
trans-unit.target: Consider the following scenarios:

trans-unit.source: Scenario 1: Using thumbprint-based certificates for securing message transfer from a bridge to a service endpoint
trans-unit.target: Scenario 1: Using thumbprint-based certificates for securing message transfer from a bridge to a service endpoint

trans-unit.source: Consider a scenario where you use thumbprint-based certificates in your <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Consider a scenario where you use thumbprint-based certificates in your <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: You update the certificate in the <token>tpm_portal</token> with the same name but a different thumbprint, but do not update the <token>msgflow_proj</token> accordingly.
trans-unit.target: You update the certificate in the <token>tpm_portal</token> with the same name but a different thumbprint, but do not update the <token>msgflow_proj</token> accordingly.

trans-unit.source: In such a scenario, the bridge might continue to process the messages because the older certificate data might still be in the channel cache.
trans-unit.target: In such a scenario, the bridge might continue to process the messages because the older certificate data might still be in the channel cache.

trans-unit.source: After that, message processing fails.
trans-unit.target: After that, message processing fails.

trans-unit.source: Workaround: Update the certificate in the <token>msgflow_proj</token> and redeploy the project.
trans-unit.target: Workaround: Update the certificate in the <token>msgflow_proj</token> and redeploy the project.

trans-unit.source: Scenario 2: Using name-based behaviors to identify certificates for securing message transfer from a bridge to a service endpoint
trans-unit.target: Scenario 2: Using name-based behaviors to identify certificates for securing message transfer from a bridge to a service endpoint

trans-unit.source: Consider a scenario where you use name-based behaviors to identify certificates in your <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Consider a scenario where you use name-based behaviors to identify certificates in your <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: You update the certificate in the <token>tpm_portal</token> but do not update the <token>msgflow_proj</token> accordingly.
trans-unit.target: You update the certificate in the <token>tpm_portal</token> but do not update the <token>msgflow_proj</token> accordingly.

trans-unit.source: In such a scenario, the bridge might continue to process the messages because the older certificate data might still be in the channel cache.
trans-unit.target: In such a scenario, the bridge might continue to process the messages because the older certificate data might still be in the channel cache.

trans-unit.source: After that, message processing fails.
trans-unit.target: After that, message processing fails.

trans-unit.source: Workaround: Update the certificate in the <token>msgflow_proj</token> and redeploy the project.
trans-unit.target: Workaround: Update the certificate in the <token>msgflow_proj</token> and redeploy the project.

trans-unit.source: Bridges continue to process messages even when the SQL database is offline
trans-unit.target: Bridges continue to process messages even when the SQL database is offline

trans-unit.source: The <token>af_integration</token> bridges continue to process messages for a while, even if the <token>ssSDSfull</token> (which stores the running information like deployed artifacts and pipelines), is offline.
trans-unit.target: The <token>af_integration</token> bridges continue to process messages for a while, even if the <token>ssSDSfull</token> (which stores the running information like deployed artifacts and pipelines), is offline.

trans-unit.source: This is because <token>af_integration</token> uses the cached artifacts and bridge configuration.
trans-unit.target: This is because <token>af_integration</token> uses the cached artifacts and bridge configuration.

trans-unit.source: If you do not want the bridges to process any messages when the <token>SQLAzDb</token> is offline, you can use the <token>af_integration</token> PowerShell cmdlets to stop or suspend the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: If you do not want the bridges to process any messages when the <token>SQLAzDb</token> is offline, you can use the <token>af_integration</token> PowerShell cmdlets to stop or suspend the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Azure BizTalk Service Management Sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=329019</linkUri></externalLink> for the Windows PowerShell cmdlets to manage operations.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Azure BizTalk Service Management Sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=329019</linkUri></externalLink> for the Windows PowerShell cmdlets to manage operations.

trans-unit.source: Reading the XML message within a bridge’s custom code component includes an extra BOM character
trans-unit.target: Reading the XML message within a bridge’s custom code component includes an extra BOM character

trans-unit.source: Consider a scenario where you want to read an XML message within a bridge’s custom code.
trans-unit.target: Consider a scenario where you want to read an XML message within a bridge’s custom code.

trans-unit.source: If you use the .NET API <codeInline>System.Text.Encoding.UTF8.GetString(bytes)</codeInline> an extra BOM character is included in the output at the beginning of the message.
trans-unit.target: If you use the .NET API <codeInline>System.Text.Encoding.UTF8.GetString(bytes)</codeInline> an extra BOM character is included in the output at the beginning of the message.

trans-unit.source: So, if you do not want the output to include the extra BOM character, you must use <codeInline>System.IO.StreamReader().ReadToEnd()</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: So, if you do not want the output to include the extra BOM character, you must use <codeInline>System.IO.StreamReader().ReadToEnd()</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Sending messages to a bridge using WCF does not scale
trans-unit.target: Sending messages to a bridge using WCF does not scale

trans-unit.source: Messages sent to a bridge using WCF does not scale.
trans-unit.target: Messages sent to a bridge using WCF does not scale.

trans-unit.source: You should instead use HttpWebRequest if you want a scalable client.
trans-unit.target: You should instead use HttpWebRequest if you want a scalable client.

trans-unit.source: UPGRADE: Token Provider error after upgrading from BizTalk Services Preview to General Availability (GA)
trans-unit.target: UPGRADE: Token Provider error after upgrading from BizTalk Services Preview to General Availability (GA)

trans-unit.source: There is an EDI or AS2 Agreement with active batches.
trans-unit.target: There is an EDI or AS2 Agreement with active batches.

trans-unit.source: When the BizTalk Service is upgraded from Preview to GA, the following may occur:
trans-unit.target: When the BizTalk Service is upgraded from Preview to GA, the following may occur:

trans-unit.source: Error: The token provider was unable to provide a security token.
trans-unit.target: Error: The token provider was unable to provide a security token.

trans-unit.source: Token provider returned message: The remote name could not be resolved.
trans-unit.target: Token provider returned message: The remote name could not be resolved.

trans-unit.source: Batch tasks are cancelled.
trans-unit.target: Batch tasks are cancelled.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Workaround</legacyBold>: After the BizTalk Service is updated to General Availability (GA), redeploy the agreement.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Workaround</legacyBold>: After the BizTalk Service is updated to General Availability (GA), redeploy the agreement.

trans-unit.source: UPGRADE: Toolbox shows the old bridge icons after upgrading the <token>af_integration</token> SDK
trans-unit.target: UPGRADE: Toolbox shows the old bridge icons after upgrading the <token>af_integration</token> SDK

trans-unit.source: After you upgrade an earlier version of the <token>af_integration</token> SDK, which had old icons representing the bridges, the toolbox continues to show the old icons for the bridges.
trans-unit.target: After you upgrade an earlier version of the <token>af_integration</token> SDK, which had old icons representing the bridges, the toolbox continues to show the old icons for the bridges.

trans-unit.source: However, if you add a bridge to <token>msgflow_proj</token> designer surface, the surface shows the new icon.
trans-unit.target: However, if you add a bridge to <token>msgflow_proj</token> designer surface, the surface shows the new icon.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Workaround</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Workaround</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: You can work around this issue by deleting the .tbd files under <codeInline><legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;system drive%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>:\Users\<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;user%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>\AppData\Local\Microsoft\VisualStudio\11.0</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: You can work around this issue by deleting the .tbd files under <codeInline><legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;system drive%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>:\Users\<legacyItalic>%%amp;lt;user%%amp;gt;</legacyItalic>\AppData\Local\Microsoft\VisualStudio\11.0</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: UPGRADE: BizTalk Portal update from Preview to GA might show an error indicating that the EDI capability is not available
trans-unit.target: UPGRADE: BizTalk Portal update from Preview to GA might show an error indicating that the EDI capability is not available

trans-unit.source: If you are logged into the <token>tpm_portal</token> while the <token>af_integration</token> is upgraded from Preview to GA, you might get the following error on the portal:
trans-unit.target: If you are logged into the <token>tpm_portal</token> while the <token>af_integration</token> is upgraded from Preview to GA, you might get the following error on the portal:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Resolution</embeddedLabel>: Log out from the portal, close and open the browser, and then log into the portal.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Resolution</embeddedLabel>: Log out from the portal, close and open the browser, and then log into the portal.

trans-unit.source: UPGRADE: New tracking data does not show up after BizTalk Services is upgraded to GA
trans-unit.target: UPGRADE: New tracking data does not show up after BizTalk Services is upgraded to GA

trans-unit.source: Assume a scenario where you have an <token>xml_bridge</token> deployed on <token>af_integration</token> Preview subscription.
trans-unit.target: Assume a scenario where you have an <token>xml_bridge</token> deployed on <token>af_integration</token> Preview subscription.

trans-unit.source: You send messages to the bridge and the corresponding tracking data is available on the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: You send messages to the bridge and the corresponding tracking data is available on the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: Now, if the <token>tpm_portal</token> and <token>af_integration</token> runtime bits are upgraded to GA, and you send a message to the same bridge endpoint deployed earlier, the tracking data does not show up for messages sent after upgrade.
trans-unit.target: Now, if the <token>tpm_portal</token> and <token>af_integration</token> runtime bits are upgraded to GA, and you send a message to the same bridge endpoint deployed earlier, the tracking data does not show up for messages sent after upgrade.

trans-unit.source: Pipelines v/s Bridges
trans-unit.target: Pipelines v/s Bridges

trans-unit.source: Throughout this document, the term ‘pipelines’ and ‘bridges’ are used interchangeably.
trans-unit.target: Throughout this document, the term ‘pipelines’ and ‘bridges’ are used interchangeably.

trans-unit.source: Both essentially mean the same thing, which is, a message processing unit deployed on <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: Both essentially mean the same thing, which is, a message processing unit deployed on <token>af_integration</token>.
